meanings.sent1: Her prenotions about the party turned out to be completely wrong.
meanings.sent2: He always has prenotions about how things will turn out.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's prenotions about cats being afraid of cucumbers made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: His prenotions about success being a straight path were shattered when he faced challenges.
meanings.sent5: The prenotions of magic in the story made it enchanting.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a preconceived notion.
meanings.sent1: The prenotions of the students were influenced by the teacher's explanation.
meanings.sent2: She engaged in prenotions before meeting new people.
meanings.sent3: The prenotions of the weatherman always made the forecast interesting.
meanings.sent4: His prenotions of the future were like pieces of a puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent5: The prenotions of success drove her to work harder.
